block.p: Amy Lynn Sagan, a daughter of Joyce and Robert Sagan of Pittsford, N.Y., is to be married today to Joshua Morris Srebnick, a son of Drs. Amy and Walter Srebnick of New York. Nancy E. Smith, an associate justice in the Appellate Division of New York State Supreme Court, is to officiate at the Sonnenberg Gardens in Canandaigua, N.Y.

The bride, 28, is a manager for sales and marketing, in New York, at the Xerox Corporation. She graduated from Skidmore College. Her father, who retired as a teacher of English and theater from the Rush-Henrietta Senior High School in Henrietta, N.Y., coordinates educational theater programs for high school students at the Rochester Broadway Theater League in Rochester. Her mother is a speech pathologist and the chairwoman of the Pittsford school district's speech department.

The bridegroom, 30, is a candidate for a Ph.D. in clinical psychology at the City University of New York. In July, he will begin an internship at Bellevue Hospital Center. He graduated from Vassar College and received a master's degree in clinical psychology from City College. His mother is a professor of history and the chairwoman of the history department at Montclair State University in Upper Montclair, N.J. His father is a professor of English at Pace University in New York.
